document_info.title: Amor fati's Nontoxic Approach to Spice Extraction
document_info.author: amor_fati
document_info.purpose: Establish thorough and reliable nontoxic method yielding results comparable to less wholesome ancestors
document_info.disclaimer: Educational reference only. Documents historical extraction chemistry research.

philosophy.background: Most common extraction techniques involve processes resembling production of less savory substances
problems_with_traditional: Large quantities of time, materials, strain, and space required

abstract.pulverization_challenge: Most households lack proper equipment to pulverize MHRB into powder
abstract.innovation: Combination of blender and mason jar - contains material reliably including messy dust
abstract.salting_process: Mix solvent with acidic water, separate layers, evaporate water layer
abstract.reliability: Renders homogeneous mixture that stays moist ensuring reaction completion

equipment: Simple blender with blade assembly for regular-mouth jar
suggested_equipment: Separatory device (separatory funnel or glass gravy separator)
Larger HDPE or glass jug for salting

step_1.action: Prepare MHRB for pulverization by breaking up by hand

step_2.action: Add 100g MHRB to regular-mouth quart mason jar

step_3.action: Attach blender blade assembly and pulverize contents thoroughly

step_4.action: Thoroughly moisten bark with vinegar, replace lid, heat in hot water bath below boiling
step_4.note: Acid and heat treatment may aid in breaking down material (steps 3-4 may prove unnecessary)

step_5.action: Add 50-100g hydrated lime to jar with sufficient water to thoroughly moisten

step_6.action: Add limonene just short of filling jar

step_7.action: Attach blender blade assembly and blend until doughy consistency

details: Cut bottom off 32oz HDPE spray bottle
Stuff cotton balls in neck loosely
Cover nape of neck with few layers of cotton rag

step_9.action: Set bottle in clean mason jar with rim loosely screwed to prevent seal
step_9.note: Remove rim before pouring out collected limonene

step_10.action: Pour contents into THP and stir while allowing limonene to pass through

step_11.action: Continue passing limonene through THP until satisfied, adding more if necessary
step_11.tip: Pour limonene into original blending jar to wash remnants into THP

step_12.action: Prepare FASW (Fumaric Acid Saturated Water) with known amount of fumaric acid

step_13.action: Combine FASW with extraction limonene in glass/HDPE jug, shake vigorously

step_14.action: Allow to separate, pour into separatory device

step_15.action: Collect bottom water layer for evaporation, top limonene for reuse

step_16.action: Evaporate at no more than 120F with sufficient airflow
step_16.tip: Scrape into pile while still wet, then continue drying
step_16.yield_calculation: Compare total weight to known fumaric acid amount

step_17.action: Purify by dissolving in water, decanting off excess fumaric acid, evaporating
step_17.indicator: Coloration shows amount of product dissolved

process_notes.mhrb_amount: 100g per THP recommended to avoid overflow and blender damage
process_notes.maximum: Strongly recommended no more than 150g at a time
process_notes.multiple_extractions: Prepare total limonene amount, add to each as needed, collect and salt as total
process_notes.other_botanicals: Process can theoretically apply to other DMT plants with minor adjustments
process_notes.mescaline: Can be used for mescaline from dried cactus with appropriate acid

advantages.nontoxic: Requires only food-grade materials with little or no health/environmental impact
advantages.household_equipment: All items readily available on open market, commonly found in home
advantages.minimal_material: Less material and cost than most other teks, easier disposal
advantages.expedient: May only require a day, yielding adequate results overnight
advantages.simplified: Many processes combined and largely automated (filtering+decanting, mixing+pulverization)
advantages.whole_mhrb: Generally cheaper, more readily available, less risk of vendor impurities or oxidation

freebase_conversion.title: Nontoxic Conversion of Full-Range Fumarate Extract to Freebase with Hasty Manual Crystallization

procedure.action: Mix DMT fumarate with equal or greater amount sodium carbonate on dish, moisten thoroughly dropwise
Allot adequate time and stirring for complete reaction
Spread moistened mixture evenly and thinly across dish
procedure.note: Thinner spread = product more likely adheres to glass, won't wash away

procedure.action: Add minimal water to dissolve sodium carbonate and salt byproduct by tilting/rolling
When all sodium carbonate dissolved and particulates settled, carefully decant water
procedure.tip: Save decanted water in case of product loss

procedure.action: Use razor blade to spread oily product thinly and firmly in cross-hatched fashion
When oil thickens to paste, use spatula to repeatedly scrape up and spread out until thickens more
Spread thinly and allow to harden to clay-like consistency
Scrape up and mold to desired form and density
Store in cool, dark place, sealed container, protected from moisture and oxygen

freebase_conversion.result: Chunks of Freebase Jurema produced by Manual Crystallization

sodium_carbonate_preparation.title: Conversion of Sodium Bicarbonate into Sodium Carbonate
process: Weigh sodium bicarbonate, put on non-aluminum pan or oven-safe dish
Place in oven at 400F (205C) for 1-1.5 hours to release CO2 and water
Alternative: Stainless steel pot on stovetop ~20 mins (will be VERY hot)
sodium_carbonate_preparation.weight_loss: Should lose around 20% of original weight
sodium_carbonate_preparation.appearance: Less powdery, closer to sugar than flour
sodium_carbonate_preparation.verification: Sodium carbonate feels looser and grainier; in oversaturated solution, bicarbonate stays powdery while carbonate rocks up
